Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the brassicaceae elicitor peptide family
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Structure Description: Sequential removal of N-terminal amino acids has little effect on activity. Activity is completely abolished when nine C-terminal amino acids remained. Removal of the C-terminal asparagine from AtPep1(9-23), resultes in a decrease in activity (12 max approximately 100 nM).
Sequence Information.Function: Elicitor of plant defense. Induces the production of plant defensin (PDF1.2) and of H2O2. Promotes resistance to the root fungal pathogen P. irregulare.
Sequence Information.Induction: By wounding, methyl jasmonate (MeJA), ethylene. The expression of the peptide PEP1 precursor is induced by the mature peptide PEP1.

Literature.Title: An endogenous peptide signal in Arabidopsis activates components of the innate immune response.
Literature.Reference: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 2006 Jun 27;103(26)10098-103.
Literature.Author: Huffaker A, Pearce G, Ryan CA.

Literature.Title: The cell surface leucine-rich repeat receptor for AtPep1, an endogenous peptide elicitor in Arabidopsis, is functional in transgenic tobacco cells.
Literature.Reference: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 2006 Jun 27;103(26)10104-9.
Literature.Author: The cell surface leucine-rich repeat receptor for AtPep1, an endogenous peptide elicitor in Arabidopsis, is functional in transgenic tobacco cells.

Literature.Title: Structure-activity studies of AtPep1, a plant peptide signal involved in the innate immune response.
Literature.Author: Pearce G, Yamaguchi Y, Munske G, Ryan CA.
